attributes.action: Make Energy Companies pay for the roll out of Smart Meters.
attributes.background: Electricity companies are rolling out Smart Meters at a cost of 11 Billion to their customers. They should be footing the bill from their profits and Government should introduce legislation to protect the rights of consumers.

attributes.action: Make all drinks producers  replace plastic containers with glass bottles.
attributes.background: Many years ago,all drinks were sold in glass bottles with very little effect on the environment,unlike the plastic containers which are causing serious pollution,especially in seas and oceans.
attributes.additional_details: A deposit scheme could be introduced to ensure most bottles were returned for re-cycling.

attributes.action: Lower taxes of pensions for U.K. Armed Forces Officers who served for 20 years
attributes.background: U.K. Armed Forces Officers get paid pensions from the Govenment, however, the government then tax it up to 40%, even though they are risking their lives for the country.

attributes.action: Introduce a higher living wage for zero hours contracts.
attributes.background: Zero hours contracts provide flexibility for employers, and uncertainty and stress for employees.  The living wage for zero hours contracts should be increased by an amount that encourages employers to provide stable employment whilst allowing employers to satisfy their genuinly volatile workloads

attributes.action: Build a link road connecting the M54 to the M6 Toll bypassing Featherstone
attributes.background: The advantages of using the M6 Toll can be negated by delays caused by congestion in Featherstone
attributes.additional_details: The road through Featherstone must produce very excessive pollution to those living along it and it must be dreadful driving in and out of those premises

attributes.action: Introduce Targeted Sanctions and Travel bans on President Trump and Inner Circle
attributes.background: President Donald Trump is breaching the US constitution, ignoring judicial orders breaking international law and separating families with his executive order revoking visas and has fired the acting Attorney General for refusing to defend an unconstitutional position.
attributes.additional_details:
Targeted sanctions similar to those applied to senior Russian leaders can be used to pressure US leadership to return from the brink of fascism before it is too late. It is important to stand early against tyrants before they can remove democratic checks and balances and the UK needs a democratic USA as ally.

People included in the sanctions should at least include the President, his children, VP, Steven Bannon, the US Cabinet and nominees and the immediate families of all those mentioned.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for teachers to stop children going to the toilet at school
attributes.background:
At school children are constantly told they cannot go to the toilet.
Going to the toilet is a basic human right and should not be taken away from you at school.

attributes.action: Posthumous pardons for witchcraft, blasphemy & other laws now deemed offensive.
attributes.background: In light of today's posthumous pardons for all gay and bisexual men convicted of decades old sexual offences (convictions which like many others I found deeply upsetting) it is patently unfair that others in history are still regarded as "guilty" of things we would no longer consider as crimes.
attributes.additional_details: As examples: Gwen Ellis sentenced to death for witchcraft in 1594; Helen Duncan, the last person to be convicted (in 1944) of witchcraft under the 1735 act, was imprisoned for nine months; John William Gott imprisoned for blasphemy on December 9, 1921 for nine months with hard labour; The Gay News and Denis Lemon convicted of blasphemous libel in 1977...

attributes.action: Have reciprocal laws for countries that do not allow property purchases
attributes.background:
Countries such as Thailand, Mexico, Hong Kong, Malaysia, all have rules that limit what a foreigner can buy or own in the terms of property and land. Yet in the UK, people from these countries can buy land or property with zero problems.
Its time that the UK government passed reciprocal laws.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.macleans.ca/economy/economicanalysis/how-the-rest-of-the-world-limits-foreign-home-buyers/

http://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/foreign-property-buyers-in-australia-face-sweeping-crackdown/news-story/21794ae0b79f2b46040bc3e5a4a7b0db

http://www.china.org.cn/english/LivinginChina/220516.htm

https://www.justlanded.com/english/Thailand/Thailand-Guide/Property/Legal-restrictions

attributes.action: Speed up A&E times in UK hospitals
attributes.background: A&E's in the UK have long waiting times to see a nurse or a doctor in the hospital (including emergencies). This has put a lot of pressure on NHS staff which has resulted in longer times to wait.
attributes.additional_details:
- Aim is to speed up the waiting times within UK hospitals.
- Put more NHS nurses and doctors back onto wards.

attributes.action: We should adapt to the same laws Canada has on young relationships
attributes.background: Many teenagers today are tried and parents try to prosecute other kids for simply dating there child even if there 1/2-years younger. We should adapt to the same laws Canada has in this field by making it so you can date anyone within a 3-year age gap if one is over 16 and one is under 16.
attributes.additional_details:
Also don't get me wrong I'm not saying have sex that should remain illegal till there 16, but kissing/cuddling etc is considered sexual contact and I think the law should be changed to prevent innocent people being prosecuted for that.

No 16-year old should be given a trial for dating someone 1-year younger when we have a older generation some with 20-year age gaps and then be quick to judge a small age gap

We need to protect children and focus on what the law was made for. Predatory Old men.

attributes.action: England should be given a referendum on leaving the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: England should be afforded the same democratic rights as Scotland by being offered a referendum on leaving the union.

attributes.action: Urge people to NOT book to go on holiday in the USA until Trump leaves office.
attributes.background: Since Trump wants to exclude certain people based solely on their religion and where they're from, and not because they committed an offence, I think we should show support by choosing not to visit the USA simply to go on holiday. I'd say especially stay away from Trump Hotels.

attributes.action: Make teachers shouting at students a criminal offence
attributes.background: After finding it rather upsetting and difficult after having being shouted at by a teacher and seeing no purpose in this form of abuse , I feel that rules need to be put in place to Stop the Shouting.

attributes.action: Prevent Barack Obama from ever visiting the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Barack Obama should not be allowed to enter the UK in any capacity due to the killing of innocent Muslims by the US army whilst he was head of the US government. 

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/dec/12/msf-afghanistan-hospital-airstrike-death-toll-42

attributes.action: Make all Utility Companies publicly owned & Running Costs paid by the Tax Payer
attributes.background: I want the government to make all Utility Companies publicly owned as Non Profit Companies & cover all Running Costs by the Tax Payer. This will ensure the disabled, elderly & people out of work can heat their houses & not have to worry about bailiffs coming to their door for non payment of bills.
attributes.additional_details: Losing your job, being elderly or disabled is financially hard enough. Many have to deal with unscrupulous bailiffs for non payment of utility bills, leaving some feeling suicidal. These vulnerable people should not be asked to pay for utility bills that they cannot afford. However, this also means that the government can pay them less benefits as their utility bills are already covered. Plus if utility companies are non profit and publicly owned, everyone's bills will be cheaper to begin with.

attributes.action: Have all secondary schools in the UK teach students mental health.
attributes.background: I feel this is import as students should know about mental health issues and the symptoms that come with it. This gives students more of an understanding of mental health and shows that it is not something they should be afraid of.
attributes.additional_details:
"Growing number of children self-harming as mental health problems amongst pupils rise, says new survey"- http://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/growing-number-of-children-self-harming-as-mental-health-problems-amongst-pupils-rise-says-new-a6912906.html

Students need to know they shouldn't be ashamed of having a mental health condition and how to deal with having a condition in the right way.

attributes.action: Reform the public broadcasting licensing law.
attributes.background:
At the moment you cannot listen to a radio or play your own music in your place of work without a public broadcasting license. This includes in your own home if you are working from there. 

The current law isn't in the spirit of its intent, which is to require a media company to get a license.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ppluk.com/

attributes.action: Theory test for car license has to be in all languages.
attributes.background: Allow people from different countries to get the license in their own language.

attributes.action: More Financial transparency for care leavers going into higher education.
attributes.background: Care leavers that come from disadvantaged backgrounds should be given total transparency over what actual support is available to them when accessing higher education. More fincial support should be offered as student loans at 7k per year is not enough specially when not at uni in the summer time.

attributes.action: Make it law for any petition with 300k+ signatures to actually be debated
attributes.background: It is disingenuous of the government to state they will only consider debating a petition if it reaches 100k. I propose that if a petition reaches 300k it must be debated whether or not the subject has been debated on a previous occasion. We must have a mechanism that ensure debates are held.

attributes.action: Put a public multi-section recycling bin on over 50% of Britain's roads
attributes.background: Roads like mine don't have enough regular bins. The country simply needs more if you expect people not to litter or have recyclable items end up in landfill. Give us lot a chance to have nicer places to live. Give us somewhere to put our rubbish and recyclable items when we're out and about.
attributes.additional_details: There are about 250,000 roads or ways in the UK, so it would be too costly to cover them but we need to start somewhere.

attributes.action: Enshrine into law 1% of GDP  to be spent in NHS funding
attributes.background: The NHS needs guaranteed spending to allow the provision of free treatment for all UK citizens to continue. In the light of the government enshrining 0.6% of GDP spending, into law, to fund Foreign Aid we call upon the government to enshrine spending of 1% of GDP, into law, to fund the NHS.

attributes.action: The National Insurance Tax to fund the NHS; Social Care & Pensions.
attributes.background:
This would ensure everyone will have contributed to their state benefits. There are more people than homes.
Funding from the councils is selective and is a second time tax by the government imposed on the few.

attributes.action: Allow Tax Relief on Commuting to Work Costs
attributes.background:
Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work. 
Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. 
▼More details
attributes.additional_details:
House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.

If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work. It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: Make training courses VAT exempt to encourage young people to learn new skills
attributes.background: I believe that training course should be VAT exempt as it helps young people learn new skills. VAT can be extremely expensive on week long course and puts may off taking them. By removing VAT from these courses it would encourage employers to invest in training to develop their employees.

attributes.action: Change the way that benefits are calculated to take cost of living into account
attributes.background: Benefit claimants living in an area where the cost of living is particularly high are at a disadvantage. Local Housing Allowance takes property prices in the applicant's area into consideration when calculating Housing Benefit entitlement, and I believe benefit rates should be calculated similarly

attributes.action: £1pw contribution to help fund NHS by ALL adults irrespective of age and income
attributes.background: I propose an idea to help fund our beloved NHS and Care Services  before they collapse under the pressure. A compulsory contribution of £1pw from all adults, controversially regardless of age and income. This would raise around 2.6b a year.
attributes.additional_details: I have calculated £2.6b a year by using the simple calculation of approx 50m adults (over 16) in UK x £1 = £50m x 52 wks = £2.600.000.000. 16 would be the starting age if not in education. For this to work I believe everyone needs to contribute. It would be easy to start excluding people because of age and income etc but this would put a greater financial burden on fewer people who would resist the charges. The NHS is freely available to all, so a small weekly contribution of £1 seems fair.

attributes.action: Call a general election in two years when the terms for Brexit are known.
attributes.background:
Whilst Parliament will be given an opportunity to comment on terms of Brexit, the UK public will not be able to vote on the biggest political decision in decades.

There is no democracy in this as the terms of Brexit were not clear when the referendum vote took place.

attributes.action: A public consultation with the people on the terms of leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
Since Britain voted to leave the EU we have heard from politicians, the media, and industry on their wants from future negotiations. 

A responsible Government should immediately begin a public consultation with the people to ensure their views are heard as part of any future negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
The British People took power on whether we wanted to leave the EU in the June 2016 referendum, we have now become the silent voice in the debate over the terms of our departure. 

This petition is about ensuring that after having made the decision, the British people continue to be consulted on the type of future they want for their country.

attributes.action: People convicted of Drink driving should be disqualified for life.
attributes.background: Too many people previously convicted return to the road to commit the same offence putting other road users and pedestrians lives at risk.

attributes.action: Allow those 18+ with ID to buy alcohol with someone under 18 present.
attributes.background: I went shopping for Christmas with a friend, wanted to buy a bottle of Baileys for the father in law, I'm 18 and my friend is 17, they would not let me have it because she did not have ID. If you're 18 you should get served. Under 18s will find a way to get alcohol no matter what anyway.
attributes.additional_details: Also, many mothers have been declined to buy alcohol for themselves because they're with their children who are not 18. Are mothers expected to abandon their children now so they can buy a bottle of wine? No.

attributes.action: Include HGV training to the Government backed 24+ Advanced Learning Loans.
attributes.background: To expand the 24+ advanced learning government backed loan to cover HGV license acquisition. There is currently a shortage of 45-50,000 drivers in the UK. Other industries are benefiting from the loan but not an industry that can create 50,000 jobs & whereby the loan could be paid back quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Driver shortage- http://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/oct/25/lorry-driver-shortage-christmas-deliveries-road-haulage-association

Courses covered: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/advanced-learner-loans-qualifications-catalogue

Ave pay for Class 1 (HGV 1) Driver £28,362 PA 
http://www.totaljobs.com/salary-checker/average-class-1-driver-salary

attributes.action: Change nhs policy that baby born before 24 weeks can intervene with life support
attributes.background: Babies born before 24 weeks in an NHS hospital should be given immediate emergency care to try get babies breathing if born not breathing or need the support when first born

attributes.action: Make every individual who claims job seekers take a drug test before claiming.
attributes.background: This is to stop individuals who claim job seekers claiming whilst containing illegal drugs in their systems. Every job seekers claimant should be free from illegal drugs and it should be a legal requirement to prove this before given their money.

attributes.action: Give the police a return deadline when an item has been seized.
attributes.background: Give the police a 2 month deadline from the date of arrest, once they have seized any item for any form of forensic analysis. After 2 months, they MUST give the property back to the suspect (unless the item has evidence on convicting them of a crime).
attributes.additional_details: A while back, I was (falsely) arrested in a case where the police seized my business laptop, after nearly a year and hundreds of phone calls to the police, my laptop was finally returned to me, and the case was dropped, however, my company had to shut down due to all my work being on that laptop, and I lost a very good company and people lost their jobs. This is all because the police could not "fit my job in" due to more important work in front of me, and never once kept me in the loop.

attributes.action: Zero tax for 18-21 year olds in education and part time working
attributes.background: People between the age of 18 and 21 can't afford to pay tax on a part time job and don't have enough time for a full time job while in education.

attributes.action: Build more houses specifically for disabled people who own a blue disabled badge
attributes.background: it will help the disabled people move around their house freely and not rely on other people and in the long run it would be cheaper for all the councils within the UK because they don't have to keep changing the adaptions that's already been done in council houses that need to be updated.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.
attributes.background: Most work places expect under 18 year olds to work for long amount of hours for hardly any money as the minimum wage is too low. Ensure a minimum of £7 a hour for under 18 year olds.

attributes.action: Introduce 24 hour GP Surgeries throughout the UK to alleviate pressure on A&E
attributes.background: Going back thirty years ago we could call our GP practice and a GP would make a home visit resulting in far fewer unnecessary hospital visits to A&E. Today we have 111 which has increased the number of unnecessary A&E visits. Surely funding the return of night time GP's would be more productive.

attributes.action: Remove political parties from UK Government Procedures
attributes.background: The people of the UK call upon the current UK Government to offer to form a cross-party coalition Government, and then to change the law to require all MPs to resign from their respective political parties. The Government should then set up regional groups of independent MPs to replace the parties.
attributes.additional_details: With no political parties, UK decisions would be made on the basis of geographical consensus, with MPs working in perhaps 12 Regional Groups at Westminster and taking their individual policy mandate from their own local councillors within their individual Constituency.

attributes.action: Drivers of vehicles found driving without all four lights fully lit to be fined.
attributes.background: A Significant amount of vehicles are seen to be driving during evening and night hours without all four lights operating.This is a serious safety hazard, particularly on unlit roads and highways.
attributes.additional_details:
Driving during the nighttime is statistically more dangerous than by   daytime.
 Far too many lights burn out or dim between MOT tests, causing potential for serious accidents.

I ask the Government to give greater police powers in In this issue including issuing Penalty Notice and Penalty Points. 

I am convinced that these changes will make are roads even safer.

attributes.action: UK Government should provide incentives to foreign startups and small companies.
attributes.background: All foreign companies  contributes  a lot  UK economy, employment by paying taxes and creating jobs.  Government  has to amend Foreign Direct Investment policy to increase investments .This can be interest free loans or  discount in VAT or Taxes.Recognise them as 'MAKE IN UK' companies.
attributes.additional_details: Due to Brexit effect all foreign companies  are in big ambiguity whether to stay in UK or NOT.Especially startup companies,budding  entrepreneurs and small scale companies are mostly effected.Fear of upcoming changes in trading law  may discourage  their plans and ventures in UK. It’s going to effect largely to the future UK economy and the growth. UK Government should encourage them.

attributes.action: Clocks should be advanced one hour forward in winter instead of summer.
attributes.background: British Summer Time (BST) has been implemented since early 1900s. However, there is little benefit that can be gained. If instead of BST, we turn the clocks one hour forward in winter, we can benefit a lot from it. Particularly in those months when we need daylight i.e. October - February
attributes.additional_details:
An introduction of British Winter Time (BWT) as an alternative to BST would be helpful in winter such that: 

1. Decent daylight would be around 07:00 which is usually the time people are leaving for work. 
2. Sunset will be at approximately 16:30 instead of 15:30 nowadays. We can have more of daylight. 

We already have too much daylight in summer and sunset during summer is at a time when people are going to sleep. Decreasing one hour from both sunrise and sunset wouldn't make much difference.

attributes.action: Cancel the Sugar Tax
attributes.background: The government is introducing the Sugar Tax a.k.a the Soft Drinks Industry Levy in 2018 and this means that soft drinks will either lose some of their good taste due to lower sugar levels or become more expensive as a result of the drink companies passing on the cost of the tax to their customers.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that this tax is an assault on freedom of choice and another example of a nanny state and I call upon the government and parliament to stop its implementation.

attributes.action: Introduce CPR and Basic First Aid to the driving test
attributes.background: CPR as well as basic first aid should be a requirement to pass a uk driving test as driving can be a dangerous thing and you never know when you may need to use those skills, which in turn could potentially save someones life

attributes.action: Support a Unilateral Declaration of Independence for the Kurdistan Region
attributes.background:
In order to maintain peace and stability, it is in the vital interest of the west and neighbours to allow the formal process. 

The KRG leadership has declared the need for an imminent referendum; and the region  has proved to be a partner in trade, the fight against terrorism, and peace for all.

attributes.action: Treat all purchases of drones in the same way as firearms
attributes.background:
DRONES are a serious threat to our security 
DRONES currently drop packages into our prisons.
DRONES were the cause of 23 near misses April-October 2015
DRONES hover over private homes, schools and parks
attributes.additional_details:
A former RAF and British Airways pilot warned that a drone hitting an airliner could result in an uncontrolled engine failure or a smashed cockpit windscreen.

A flight safety specialist insisted the large amount of data available is not a true representation of what would happen with a drone because "birds don't have a big lump of lithium battery in them".

The UK Airprox Board (UKAB) has published reports on the incidents, which took place between April 11 and October 4 last year.

attributes.action: Give parents the power to decide what their child drinks at school.
attributes.background: My son, 9 years old is autistic and also suffers from OCD and Tourettes, he has always disliked anything without a strong taste, you can imagine the task of getting him to drink water or milk, he has suffered through so many bouts of dehydration at school and many headaches. I want to change this.
attributes.additional_details: I know and have read so many parents stories of how their child/children don't like the taste of water and we can't change our children's taste buds can we? Yes water and milk is a far healthier option no one disagrees but is dehydrating the students risking more damage to their growing bodies. Why can the teachers drink as much tea and coffee fizzy and whatever they fancy whilst the children must only have water, as their parents should it not be our choice to prevent illness and dehydration.

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory attendance to a 'Safe Drive Stay Alive' event
attributes.background: This event is used as means of reducing the amount of accidents and road collisions. It is vital that people are aware of the minor things that can significantly impact their lives, and the lives of others. I believe it should be made mandatory before a person can officially gain their licence.
attributes.additional_details:
'Stay Drive Stay Alive' found that young drivers are much more likely to be involved in a crash on the roads, often due to inexperience and a lack of knowledge of the risks. 
*Around 1 in 4 deaths on the road is aged 17-24*
The Safe Drive Stay Alive campaign will reach new and pre-drivers in an emotive and hard-hitting way, influencing behaviour and attitude on the roads.
